IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Forman School is an independent, coeducational college preparatory school for boarding and day students with identified learning differences. Forman develops the whole student so that every graduate becomes an educated, confident, self-advocate throughout life.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Forman School is an independent,
IRS990.Desc: OPERATE AND MAINTAIN A PRIVATE SCHOOL (GRADES 9-12) FOR CHILDREN WITH SPECIFIC LEARNING DIFFERENCES AND TO PREPARE THEM FOR A COLLEGE CURRICULUM.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: Asst Head of School for Inst Advancement
Assistant Head of School for Internal Affairs

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School invests its endowment funds to generate income and long-term growth. The income of which is utiliaed in accordance with donor stipulations, if any, and support of the School's exempt activites. The appreciation is utilized in accordance with the School's spending policy.
$160,521 Cost of Goods Sold on School store sales less $849 Net Tuition Refunds.
$160,521 Cost of Goods Sold on School store sales less $849 Net Tuition Refunds.

Management believes the School has no uncertain tax positions as of June 30, 2016. The Federal Form 990 and 990-T are subject to examination by the IRS, generally for three years after they were filed. The School's Federal and State tax filings prior to the year ended June 30, 2013 are closed.

A STATEMENT OF NONDISCRIMINATION WAS INCLUDED IN THE REGISTRATION FORM, ON THE SCHOOL'S WEBSITE AND THE NEWSPAPER ADVERTISEMENTS. THE SCHOOL'S NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY WAS INCLUDED IN STUDENT REGRISTRATION DOCUMENTS, SCHOOL'S WEBSITE, AND NEWSPAPER ADVERTISEMENTS.
The School determines elgibility for financial aid based on financial need of each recipient.

The Head of School is required to live on campus in order to effectively perform his duties, which includes hosting events and to be available to faculty and students. "Personal Services" consist of approximately 5 hours of housekeeping services per week at the residence of the Head of School.
Former Associate Head of School was paid a severence in the equivalent of six months of salary. The severence was approved by the Board of Directors.
The Form 990 is reviewed by Management of the School prior to its submission to the IRS.

The School has a formal written conflict of interest policy and each Board Member is required to submit a signed conflict of interest disclosure statement annually. The copies of the signed statements are maintained by the assistant to the Head of School.
The Compensation Committee of the School uses school comparability statistics and National Association of Independant Schools benchmark studies to determine compensation of the Head of School.

The Head of School uses school comparability statistics and National Association of Independant Schools benchmark studies to determine compensation of all other key employees and other officers of the School.

The School has made the Form 990, governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements available in a file maintained in the administrative office of the School available upon request.
